item.title: Road Ahead Closed sign, 11th December
item.description:
Sign remains from road closure last week. Potentially causing confusion and impacting surrounding residential areas. (Why does your reporting system insist on a sub-category when sometimes none is suitable? I have therefore chosen the one that I beleve will be treated as highest priority!)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hereford Place, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Very Large pothole as heading towards cleeve from Wyman’s Lane, 10th December
item.description:
On Hyde Lane just after houses as you head towards bishops cleeve from Wyman’s lane on the edge of the road. Pothole is very large and deep and difficult to avoid when there is oncoming traffic as not much room to avoid - in the national speed limit zone. Caused me to pop my tyre in the dark which needed replacing and cost £150. I am requesting reimbursement for the cost of repairing my tyre, which was damaged after hitting a pothole on a council-maintained road. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
